channel.description:
V.O.R. is back! Join comic book artists Mike Wagganer and Ed Siemienkowicz as they shoot the bull about life, love, comics, politics, and of course, Star Wars. Hilarious insight on everything under the sun, and also featuring guest hosts from time to time.
Updated monthly. More info at www.VORradio.com This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

item.title: Who's there? Mike and... Eddie?
item.author: voiceofrep@gmail.com
item.description:
Don't go burning down your local movie theater adorned in VOR t-shirts and Clone helmets, but VOR is back, albeit briefly. Mike and Ed return to your future box to catch up, talk some Star Wars smack, and look back on the last year. Bring us along as you attempt to finish your last-munute shopping, or if you need to escape your screaming wife and/or children. We're back for YOU!
Special Thanks: Martin Solveig and Dragonette - Hello The Joy Formidable - Whirring

item.title: MAY THE FORCE BE WITH YOUR ASSES Pt. 2
item.author: voiceofrep@gmail.com
item.description:
Star Wars rolls on, like mysterious paragraphs of words scrolling onward into the great, unknown universe. Voice of the Republic, however, has read that scroll too many times to count. We're hanging up our blasters, and becoming the crazy old hermits we are supposed to be.
Ah, fuck that. You know we're going to be here making bigger noises of our own. We hope you follow us on our journeys, separate though they may be. We thank you for all the years of downloading, listening, and urging us onward. Come by and see us any time. The shows are up forever, and the Vorum never closes.

item.title: We're Sorry... That's Never Happened To Us Before...
item.author: voiceofrep@gmail.com
item.description:
Really, that was... just... wow. Sorry. You don't have to say, that, we know how it is, but listen. We're eating less beef, and drinking more green tea with ginseng. We're even doing push-ups. Yeah, totally! Like 10 for every commercial during Murder She Wrote. Next time, raincheck, for real.
Anyway, we got a great show for you, giving you what you deserve - The Future of Star Wars!* We never do this, but feel free to skip the previous regular episode.

item.title: Sympathy For The Devil
item.author: voiceofrep@gmail.com
item.description:
Is it possible that George Lucas is innocent for the decline of the Star Wars legacy? If so who is to blame for the current onslaught of inferior spin-offs, conspicuous consumption, tracheotomies, divorce and even Star Wars Babies? Yes, that's right.
Learn all about it, and about the hot women who love our show (not just our moms, by the way) on the newest Voice of the Republic podcast. Subscribe NOW!

item.title: That September Feeling
item.author: voiceofrep@gmail.com
item.description:
The winds change, the air cools, and the cicadas have all faded away. Kids are in school, pools are closing for the year. The flood of summer fun gives way to the slow calm of Autumn, and the anticipation of changing leaves, bundling up, and the onset of snowflakes and the holiday season.
And that means TOYS!
Ed and Mike are joined this time by Ed's friend Martin, from the U.K. The Force is strong with VOR as they hash about video games, Karen Traviss, and, of course, lots of toy talk.

item.title: The Yikes!
item.author: voiceofrep@gmail.com
item.description:
You know the feeling when you eat too much sugar on Halloween and you feel like your windpipe is closing up, your palms are sweaty and your tongue no longer tastes... taste? Now, do you also know how similar that is to when you see something that is so cheesy and off base from something you love? That's the Yikes. Also known as the heebie-jeebies and the creepy-crawlies, this show is about things in the history of Star Wars that go astray from the pure story, the solid characters and the integrity of the brand. Mace's Purple Passion? The Marriage of Mara Jade and Luke? Wha happened?
VOR fans! Let us know what has given YOU the Yikes! Call the Republicomm at 407-347-2107.
Special Thanks: K's Choice - Not An Addict
Lionel Richie - Still
Starbuck - Moonlight
